page.title: 18THE STEAM ENGINES OF FENWICK
page.content: In{Fenwick}there lives an old gentleman in his 70's. He has lived there all his life. He worked on his father's farm when he was young. He remembers working with{traction {engines}and has always had a love for them. He now finds old engines and {rebuilds}them, making the parts himself. He has one traction engine that he takes to shows all over the country. He can travel at 4 m.p.h. The traction engine has a{tender}to carry the coal and water. He is rebulding an engine at the moment that was built in 1889. He found it in a dyke on the farm his father used to work. He remembers working with this machine when he was a small boy.
